column1: The Monday after the walking expedition
column2: Grace Harlowe set out for school full of an idea that had been revolving in her busy brain for weeks. The time had come for herself and for her three chums to bind themselves together as a sorority. As charter members
column3: they would initiate four other girls
column4: as soon as proper rites could be thought of. It should be a Greek letter society. Grace thought "Phi Sigma Tau" would sound well. Aside from the social part
column5: their chief object would be to keep a watchful eye open for girls in school who needed assistance of any sort.Mrs. Gray's anxiety over Eleanor Savell had set the bee in Grace's bonnet buzzing
column6: and now her plans were practically perfected. All that remained to be done was to tell her three friends
column7: and consult them as to what other four girls would be eligible to membership.
